alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:08PM CDT until May 17 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 142.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday was 143.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 142.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 138.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 142.1 feet on 04/19/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Lake Creek Sendera Ranch Roa 138.0 142.7 Mon 7 pm CDT 138.3 134.1 130.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 815 AM CDT.
